citeinfo.title: ESRI Data & Maps 2006 : U.S. Census Block Centroid Populations : New Jersey

serinfo.issue: 2006 World, Europe, United States, Canada, and Mexico

descript.abstract: U.S. Census Block Centroid Populations : New Jersey represents the populations of the U.S. Census blocks for the state of New Jersey. U.S. Census blocks are the smallest geographic entities within a county for which the Census Bureau tabulates population.
descript.purpose: U.S. Census Block Centroid Populations : New Jersey provides population and other demographic information for each U.S. Census block centroid within New Jersey.
descript.supplinf: Largest scale when displaying the data: 1:100,000.

The data are provided by multiple, third party data vendors under license to ESRI for inclusion on ESRI Data & Maps for use with ESRI software. Each data vendor has its own data licensing policies and may grant varying redistribution rights to end users. Please consult the redistribution rights below for this data set provided on ESRI Data & Maps. idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 1; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.1.0.722

dataqual.logic: The shapefile is converted to SDC (Smart Data Compression) format using either ESRI SDC Data Development Kit Professional 2 (DDKP2) or tools in ArcGIS. The SDC data set is then loaded into ArcSDE to verify and validate the geometry.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the data set is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.

horizpa.horizpar: The geospatial part of this data set was calculated from latitude/longitude coordinates. The horizontal positional accuracy is unknown.

citeinfo.title: Summary File 1 (SF1)
citeinfo.othercit: The Summary File 1 (SF1) data is based on the 2000 Census of Population. It provides attributes POP2000, HOUSEHOLDS, and HSE_UNITS.

citeinfo.title: ESRI Data & Maps 2006 : U.S. Census Block Centroid Populations : United States

serinfo.issue: 2006 World, Europe, United States, Canada, and Mexico

srcinfo.srccontr: National layer from which states layers were derived.

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by ESRI: Extracted the block inventory (block points that include centroid latitude and longitude coordinates) files from Dynamap/Census Boundaries v. 6.0. Merged the block points into a national shapefile. Checked that all the block points reside within the correct block group polygons using a spatial overlay. As a result: 1) corrected latitude and longitude coordinate errors for features in Alaska, and 2) moved block points that were in the incorrect block group and updated the latitude and longitude values of the block points. Attached the U.S. Census SF1 attributes POP2000, HSE_UNITS, and HOUSEHOLDS. Added attributes STATE_FIPS, CNTY_FIPS, STCOFIPS, TRACT, and BLOCK and created their values from parsing the values of the FIPS attribute. Converted the data set to SDC. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices.

cntinfo.cntinst: In the United States-Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing and consulting services to your local ESRI Regional Office. For support, you may contact Technical Support by telephone (voice) between 6:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. Pacific time, Monday through Friday, by dialing 909-793-3774; facsimile (fax) available at 909-792-0960; electronic mail (e-mail) support@esri.com; or visit http://support.esri.com; ESRI holidays excluded. Outside the United States-Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local ESRI International Distributor. This information can be found at http://gis.esri.com/intldist/contactint.cfm. For other questions or comments, you may contact ESRI headquarters by e-mail, telephone, or fax or write to us.

procstep.procdesc: The original U.S. Census Block Centroid layer was downloaded from the ESRI Data and Maps 2006 DVD in SDC (Smart Data Compression) format. In order to create state-wide subsets of the large national-coverage dataset, the original layer was exported from SDC to Shapefile format and then divided by state by running a script based on the State FIPS code in the attribute table. Each state layer was then exported into an ArcSDE 9.1 database using the Feature Class to Feature Class tool in ArcCatalog 9.2.

enttyp.enttypd: The points represent the centroids of census blocks, the smallest entity for which the Census Bureau collects and tabulates decennial census information within United States; bounded on all sides by visible features such as streets, streams, and railroad tracks, and by invisible boundaries such as city, town, and county limits.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The FIPS code (two-digit number) for the state in which the block is located.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Commerce, National Institute of Standards and Technology

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The FIPS code (three-digit number) for the county in which the block is located.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Commerce, National Institute of Standards and Technology

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The combined state and county FIPS code. County FIPS codes begin with 001 for each state, use the combined code (five-digit number) to uniquely identify a county.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Commerce, National Institute of Standards and Technology

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The four-digit number, with a two-digit suffix, used to identify a census tract. Census tract numbers are always unique within a county and usually unique within an metropolitan area.

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The Census code (four-digit number) for the block.

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The combined state and county FIPS codes, and tract and block Census codes.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Commerce, National Institute of Standards and Technology and Census Bureau

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The total number of housing units in the block in 2000.
The total number of households in the block in 2000.
